Bachelor & Hunchback

1.Hunchback: There! Gotcha! The man to do the job! Help me, kind sir, save my poor soul! You're walking all 'round the town, dontcha, your line of work demanding it and all that? Right? Please find my daughter! My little darling thing hasn't come home today...

1.Hunchback: There! Gotcha! The man to do the job! Help me, kind sir, save my poor soul! You're walking all 'round the town, dontcha, your line of work demanding it and all that? Right? Please find my daughter! My little darling thing hasn't come home today...

2.Bachelor: Was she kidnapped?

2.Bachelor: Was she kidnapped?

3.Hunchback: She must've left at dawn and she's still not back... I went to sleep and slept like a log-the twyrine haze does that to you-and by my side was the pretty thing sleeping. In the morning, I woke up to find her gone. Neighbours didn't see a thing, them blind bats... I'd give you anything... I'm rich! Wanna get a hudred thousand? A hundred and fifty?

3.Hunchback: She must've left at dawn and she's still not back... I went to sleep and slept like a log-the twyrine haze does that to you-and by my side was the pretty thing sleeping. In the morning, I woke up to find her gone. Neighbours didn't see a thing, them blind bats... I'd give you anything... I'm rich! Wanna get a hudred thousand? A hundred and fifty?

4.Bachelor: Any stipulations?

4.Bachelor: Any stipulations?

5.Hunchback: No stupid-lations! Just find my lovely little thing. Bring her back to me!

5.Hunchback: No stupid-lations! Just find my lovely little thing. Bring her back to me!

6.Bachelor: How do I recognize her?

6.Bachelor: How do I recognize her?

7.Hunchback: Name's Willow. She's seventeen... Dark wavy hair and the beauty of a... very, very beautiful girl... No distinctive marks though... She's a lovely singer and dancer... Now's not a good time for singing and dancing though, so I dunno...

7.Hunchback: Name's Willow. She's seventeen... Dark wavy hair and the beauty of a... very, very beautiful girl... No distinctive marks though... She's a lovely singer and dancer... Now's not a good time for singing and dancing though, so I dunno...

8.Bachelor: Where should I go looking for her?

8.Bachelor: Where should I go looking for her?

9.Hunchback: I dunno! Everywhere! She might be in an infected district-or maybe not... Oh, what if she was murdered... slaughtered... seized by them patrolmorons and thrown into jail? I've been to the Town Hall though... No sign of my little girl...

9.Hunchback: I dunno! Everywhere! She might be in an infected district-or maybe not... Oh, what if she was murdered... slaughtered... seized by them patrolmorons and thrown into jail? I've been to the Town Hall though... No sign of my little girl...

10.Bachelor: All right. I'll try... Though I must tell I don't feel like I'm likely to succeed.

10.Bachelor: All right. I'll try... Though I must tell I don't feel like I'm likely to succeed.

11.Hunchback: Here. Have some money. In advance. I've got more where it came from. This is criminal money, illicit money, earned through baddoing; it's time it served a good purpose. Those thugs, those robbers...! I've always hated them! Even Nina couldn't take my daughter away from me... How can this be happening now? Huh? After all those years of having her here?

11.Hunchback: Here. Have some money. In advance. I've got more where it came from. This is criminal money, illicit money, earned through baddoing; it's time it served a good purpose. Those thugs, those robbers...! I've always hated them! Even Nina couldn't take my daughter away from me... How can this be happening now? Huh? After all those years of having her here?

12.Bachelor: Wait for me here.

12.Bachelor: Wait for me here.

12.Bachelor: Your choice of words... is disturbing. I don't think I'll bring the girl back to you.

12.Bachelor: Your choice of words... is disturbing. I don't think I'll bring the girl back to you.

10.Bachelor: Oh, I don't need that to make you shell out the money. How would you like to have your Caravan past known to the public?

10.Bachelor: Oh, I don't need that to make you shell out the money. How would you like to have your Caravan past known to the public?

11.Hunchback: The Caravan... Why? Why wouldja do that?

11.Hunchback: The Caravan... Why? Why wouldja do that?

12.Bachelor: To make you pay. Did you say a hundred and fifty thousand?

12.Bachelor: To make you pay. Did you say a hundred and fifty thousand?

13.Hunchback: You evil toerag! D'ya think this is the time to have a laugh at my expense? D'ya think I'm all worked up 'bout keeping my precious sweet life? I'll rip your throat out with my teeth, you little dweeb!

13.Hunchback: You evil toerag! D'ya think this is the time to have a laugh at my expense? D'ya think I'm all worked up 'bout keeping my precious sweet life? I'll rip your throat out with my teeth, you little dweeb!

14.Bachelor: Cut it...

14.Bachelor: Cut it...

14.Bachelor: Calm down. Let's talk it over...

14.Bachelor: Calm down. Let's talk it over...

15.Hunchback: Here. Have some money. In advance. I've got more where it came from. This is criminal money, illicit money, earned through baddoing; it's time it served a good purpose. Those thugs, those robbers...! I've always hated them! Even Nina couldn't take my daughter away from me... How can this be happening now? Huh? After all those years of having her here?

15.Hunchback: Here. Have some money. In advance. I've got more where it came from. This is criminal money, illicit money, earned through baddoing; it's time it served a good purpose. 16.Bachelor: Wait for me here.

16.Bachelor: Wait for me here.

16.Bachelor: Your choice of words... is disturbing. I don't think I'll bring the girl back to you.

16.Bachelor: Your choice of words... is disturbing. I don't think I'll bring the girl back to you.

12.Bachelor: A hundred thousand is enough though.

12.Bachelor: A hundred thousand is enough though.

13.Hunchback: You evil toerag! D'ya think this is the time to have a laugh at my expense? D'ya think I'm all worked up 'bout keeping my precious sweet life? I'll rip your throat out with my teeth, you little dweeb!

13.Hunchback: You evil toerag! D'ya think this is the time to have a laugh at my expense? D'ya think I'm all worked up 'bout keeping my precious sweet life? I'll rip your throat out with my teeth, you little dweeb!

14.Bachelor: Cut it...

14.Bachelor: Cut it...

14.Bachelor: Calm down. Let's talk it over...

14.Bachelor: Calm down. Let's talk it over...

15.Hunchback: Here. Have some money. In advance. I've got more where it came from. This is criminal money, illicit money, earned through baddoing; it's time it served a good purpose. Those thugs, those robbers...! I've always hated them! Even Nina couldn't take my daughter away from me... How can this be happening now? Huh? After all those years of having her here?

15.Hunchback: Here. Have some money. In advance. I've got more where it came from. This is criminal money, illicit money, earned through baddoing; it's time it served a good purpose. Those thugs, those robbers...! I've always hated them! Even Nina couldn't take my daughter away from me... How can this be happening now? Huh? After all those years of having her here?

16.Bachelor: Wait for me here.

16.Bachelor: Wait for me here.

16.Bachelor: Your choice of words... is disturbing. I don't think I'll bring the girl back to you.

8.Bachelor: No resemblance to you then?

4.Bachelor: What happened to your daughter?

5.Hunchback: She must've left at dawn and she's still not back... I went to sleep and slept like a log-the twyrine haze does that to you-and by my side was the pretty thing sleeping. In the morning, I woke up to find her gone. Neighbours didn't see a thing, them blind bats... I'd give you anything... I'm rich! Wanna get a hudred thousand? A hundred and fifty?

Bachelor & Carouser

1.Carouser: Feeding my starving children by having pulled a knife on someone has been an enticing option all along-and all too long I held back! Well, not anymore I won't. Paying for your honesty by being locked up in a prison cell together with the Sand Plague-or becoming a marauder? I'd rather prefer the latter!

1.Carouser: Feeding my starving children by having pulled a knife on someone has been an enticing option all along-and all too long I held back! Well, not anymore I won't. Paying for your honesty by being locked up in a prison cell together with the Sand Plague-or becoming a marauder? I'd rather prefer the latter!

2.Bachelor: You'd rather not. Marauders to a town are like bacilli to a body-and deserve the same treatment.

2.Bachelor: You'd rather not. Marauders to a town are like bacilli to a body-and deserve the same treatment.

3.Carouser: They're already arresting innocent people, so we don't have a choice! We'll gang up to make patrolhounds think twice before even approaching us. And to hell with anyone who gets in our way!

3.Carouser: They're already arresting innocent people, so we don't have a choice! We'll gang up to make patrolhounds think twice before even approaching us. And to hell with anyone who gets in our way!

4.Bachelor: Watch out, kind sir. The law is the law-even now.

4.Bachelor: Watch out, kind sir. The law is the law-even now.

4.Bachelor: There is always a bigger power.

4.Bachelor: There is always a bigger power.

2.Bachelor: This line of thinking does you little honour, however angry you are.

2.Bachelor: This line of thinking does you little honour, however angry you are.

3.Carouser: Is it honour time now, though? Who cares about honour at all... all we want is to survive.

3.Carouser: Is it honour time now, though? Who cares about honour at all... all we want is to survive.

4.Bachelor: One must never forget their honour.

6.Bachelor: There is always a bigger power.

Bachelor & Executor

1.Executor: It's here! The Sand Plague is already in the left wing! We're working our beaks to the bone taking the dead out! But the hungry jaws of the Sand Pest are rustling...

1.Executor: It's here! The Sand Plague is already in the left wing! We're working our beaks to the bone taking the dead out! But the hungry jaws of the Sand Pest are rustling...

2.Bachelor: Let the uninfected out! Quickly!

2.Bachelor: Let the uninfected out! Quickly!

3.Executor: It's futile. Although... half an hour ago a certain kind person provided us with a display of true goodwill and compassion. He'd bought out several dozen people.

3.Executor: It's futile. Although... half an hour ago a certain kind person provided us with a display of true goodwill and compassion. He'd bought out several dozen people.

4.Bachelor: I'd like to buy out the rest.

4.Bachelor: I'd like to buy out the rest.

5.Executor: Get the cash on the nail. Even if Saburov refuses to take your money, we won't; we're not the scrupulous type. Ten thousand per person. Sixty thousand for the whole batch.

5.Executor: Get the cash on the nail. Even if Saburov refuses to take your money, we won't; we're not the scrupulous type. Ten thousand per person. Sixty thousand for the whole batch.

6.Bachelor: A bit too much, isn't it?

6.Bachelor: A bit too much, isn't it?

7.Executor: We don't know for sure if those people are truly innocent. What if there are thieves, murderers, or looters among them? What if we let an unspeakable villain out? The price includes the risk-taking.

7.Executor: We don't know for sure if those people are truly innocent. What if there are thieves, murderers, or looters among them? What if we let an unspeakable villain out? The price includes the risk-taking.

8.Bachelor: Can't you tell a murderer from an honest person?

8.Bachelor: Can't you tell a murderer from an honest person?

9.Executor: Of course we can't! It's not like the patrolgoons cared about the paperwork when they were collaring these poor souls. Who are they? What have they done to deserve this treatment? Hell if anyone knows now! Eh, forget the poor wretches. Let it go-unlike us, you can do it for free... There's only a handful of convicts left in there anyway.

Bachelor & Man

1.Man: Feeding my starving children by having pulled a knife on someone has been an enticing option all along-and all too long I held back! Well, not anymore I won't. Paying for your honesty by being locked up in a prison cell together with the Sand Plague-or becoming a marauder? I'd rather prefer the latter!

1.Man: Feeding my starving children by having pulled a knife on someone has been an enticing option all along-and all too long I held back! Well, not anymore I won't. Paying for your honesty by being locked up in a prison cell together with the Sand Plague-or becoming a marauder? I'd rather prefer the latter!

2.Bachelor: You'd rather not. Marauders to a town are like bacilli to a body-and deserve the same treatment.

2.Bachelor: You'd rather not. Marauders to a town are like bacilli to a body-and deserve the same treatment.

3.Man: They're already arresting innocent people, so we don't have a choice! We'll gang up to make patrolhounds think twice before even approaching us. And to hell with anyone who gets in our way!

3.Man: They're already arresting innocent people, so we don't have a choice! We'll gang up to make patrolhounds think twice before even approaching us. And to hell with anyone who gets in our way!

4.Bachelor: There is always a bigger power.

Day 6

Bachelor & Boy

1.Boy: Dirty lies, all of it! Let me tell you, that salty liquid was neither water nor tears. The foul maneater sprinkled people's lips with blood, that's what she did. Notkin told me that in the age of the Blind Aurochs' Skin, there used to be a rite that worked just like that.

1.Boy: Dirty lies, all of it! Let me tell you, that salty liquid was neither water nor tears. The foul maneater sprinkled people's lips with blood, that's what she did. Notkin told me that in the age of the Blind Aurochs' Skin, there used to be a rite that worked just like that.

2.Bachelor: What do you mean?

2.Bachelor: What do you mean?

3.Boy: Blood. I'm talking about blood. We obviously have to find her now. How is that hard to grasp?

3.Boy: Blood. I'm talking about blood. We obviously have to find her now. How is that hard to grasp?

4.Bachelor: More maneater-hunting?

4.Bachelor: More maneater-hunting?

5.Boy: Well, it's a very lackluster hunt-consider the culprit already found. The Cathedral guards were bribed by one of ladies of particular notoriety-so it was she that did the whole thing, that's clear as day. Crept into the Cathedral naked, with just a cloak on, and sprayed the beds with rat blood! That was her plan-that the half-awake people wouldn't be able to realize what's going on in their sleepy confusion.

5.Boy: Well, it's a very lackluster hunt-consider the culprit already found. The Cathedral guards were bribed by one of ladies of particular notoriety-so it was she that did the whole thing, that's clear as day. Crept into the Cathedral naked, with just a cloak on, and sprayed the beds with rat blood! That was her plan-that the half-awake people wouldn't be able to realize what's going on in their sleepy confusion.

6.Bachelor: What happened here?

6.Bachelor: What happened here?

7.Boy: It happened at night. They woke up in the morning to find out that there were only two types of people in the Cathedral, the dead and the soon-to-be. Tried to force the doors-both the lucky and the not so much-but no can do. No unauthorized exit! And here you go, five hundred stiffs. Thankfully, at least none of our guys were inside when that happened. Those dumbheads.

7.Boy: It happened at night. They woke up in the morning to find out that there were only two types of people in the Cathedral, the dead and the soon-to-be. Tried to force the doors-both the lucky and the not so much-but no can do. No unauthorized exit! And here you go, five hundred stiffs. Thankfully, at least none of our guys were inside when that happened. Those dumbheads.

8.Bachelor: Watch your tongue, you brat!

8.Bachelor: Watch your tongue, you brat!

8.Bachelor: It's horrible.

8.Bachelor: It's horrible.

4.Bachelor: What?!

4.Bachelor: What?!

5.Boy: Ever seen blood? Warm, salty, infected-that's what it was like. Do I have to spell it out for you or what? The only upside is that the witch's been seen. Now we're onto her.

5.Boy: Ever seen blood? Warm, salty, infected-that's what it was like. Do I have to spell it out for you or what? The only upside is that the witch's been seen. Now we're onto her.

6.Bachelor: I wonder how you're goinf to catch her.

7.Boy: Well, it's a very lackluster hunt-consider the culprit already found. The Cathedral guards were bribed by one of ladies of particular notoriety-so it was she that did the whole thing, that's clear as day. Crept into the Cathedral naked, with just a cloak on, and sprayed the beds with rat blood! That was her plan-that the half-awake people wouldn't be able to realize what's going on in their sleepy confusion.

8.Bachelor: What happened here?

8.Bachelor: What happened here?

9.Boy: It happened at night. They woke up in the morning to find out that there were only two types of people in the Cathedral, the dead and the soon-to-be. Tried to force the doors-both the lucky and the not so much-but no can do. No unauthorized exit! And here you go, five hundred stiffs. Thankfully, at least none of our guys were inside when that happened. Those dumbheads.

Bachelor & Man

1.Man: Today is the day when we finally kill her. Whoever she is, mara, Lara, or my own sister-it's time to put an end to her feast.

1.Man: Today is the day when we finally kill her. Whoever she is, mara, Lara, or my own sister-it's time to put an end to her feast.

2.Bachelor: What if it really turns out to be your sister?

2.Bachelor: What if it really turns out to be your sister?

3.Man: Sometimes ghosts spirit children away from their very cradles. They say it happened to a family of my neighbours; a herdsman's daughter have been hiding hooves under her dress for three years straight. A shabnak had killed her and put her white skin on; he wanted to get to the pots with fresh milk. If it's my sister, then she must be a turnskin or a changeling.

3.Man: Sometimes ghosts spirit children away from their very cradles. 6.Bachelor: Why was their death so fast?

The feverish ones remained here. The overseers took care of them, taking the dead to Earth. They think it's their fault... that the casualty rate is almost absolute.

Bachelor & Woman

1.Woman: I, for one, do not believe that Cathedral girl was a mara... I think her intentions were good. They ran out of food and water by that time; she must have been trying to feed the weakest. Perhaps there was something on her clothes. Or perhaps it wasn't her at all?

1.Woman: I, for one, do not believe that Cathedral girl was a mara... I think her intentions were good. They ran out of food and water by that time; she must have been trying to feed the weakest. Perhaps there was something on her clothes. Or perhaps it wasn't her at all?

2.Bachelor: What Cathedral girl?

2.Bachelor: What Cathedral girl?

3.Woman: Some girl or lady infiltrated the Cathedral at night. I've heard people say that she descended from above, but I think she must've slipped through the entrance. Having tricked the guards, I mean... The poor thing must've been so scared... And see how that turned out.

4.Bachelor: And how did it...?

4.Bachelor: And how did it...?

5.Woman: Haven't you been told, doctor? Hurry up then, perhaps there is still a chance that you might save someone. They've all died during the night, and those who haven't are passing on now... Perhaps you can still do something.

6.Bachelor: There is only one remedy for that,

4.Bachelor: Didn't I tell you to guard the Cathedral extremely vigilantly? To not-under any bloody circumstances!-let anyone in or out? You people... are absolutely impossible!

Bachelor & Factory Worker

1.Factory Worker: She was offering something to drink. That I'm certain of. There was no water, so they accepted hers-well, whatever she was cupping in her hands. She must have accidentally grabbed putrid water. I bet there was no foul intent.

1.Factory Worker: She was offering something to drink. That I'm certain of. There was no water, so they accepted hers-well, whatever she was cupping in her hands. She must have accidentally grabbed putrid water. I bet there was no foul intent.

2.Bachelor: Who are you talking about?

2.Bachelor: Who are you talking about?

3.Factory Worker: The girl... She took pity on the Cathedral sods, sneaked in to get to them, and gave them something to drink. I mean, they were all crammed together in darkness, it must've been torture.

3.Factory Worker: The girl... She took pity on the Cathedral sods, sneaked in to get to them, and gave them something to drink. I mean, they were all crammed together in darkness, it must've been torture.

4.Bachelor: What happened in the Cathedral?

Day 7

Bachelor & Ayan

1.Ayan: Finally you're here, oynon! There's been a disaster, have you heard already? My master told me to fetch you immediately!

1.Ayan: Finally you're here, oynon! There's been a disaster, have you heard already? My master told me to fetch you immediately!

2.Bachelor: Your master? Who's that?

2.Bachelor: Your master? Who's that?

3.Ayan: Are you alone? Is your woman not here?

3.Ayan: Are you alone? Is your woman not here?

4.Bachelor: Evidently.

4.Bachelor: Evidently.

5.Ayan: Hurry up and go to Andrey then. He needs your help to make her come back, to take her away from the Worms. She went to them of her own accord, but he said that was because she'd gone mad.

5.Ayan: Hurry up and go to Andrey then. He needs your help to make her come back, to take her away from the Worms. She went to them of her own accord, but he said that was because she'd gone mad.

6.Bachelor: So he knows where Eva is? I need to know what he wanted you to tell me-and I need to know the exact words!

6.Bachelor: So he knows where Eva is? I need to know what he wanted you to tell me-and I need to know the exact words!

7.Ayan: Don't be angry with me, oynon... Andrey told me to make a dash for the oynon's place as quickly as I could to check if his woman was there. If I found her, I was to tell her that he was coming and make sure she doesn't harm herself. If I do not find her but find the oynon, he told me to fetch you. He said you two would have to face trouble.

7.Ayan: Don't be angry with me, oynon... Andrey told me to make a dash for the oynon's place as quickly as I could to check if his woman was there. If I found her, I was to tell her that he was coming and make sure she doesn't harm herself. If I do not find her but find the oynon, he told me to fetch you. He said you two would have to face trouble.

8.Bachelor: I don't understand a thing!

8.Bachelor: I don't understand a thing!

9.Ayan: Neither do I. But Andrey does. Help him, so that he doesn't get himself killed... He is unarmed. He gave his weapon to the Changeling. Then he told me to run here, run as fast as I could. And so I did, like a leaf on the wind, like the wind itself-that's how fast I was!

9.Ayan: Neither do I. But Andrey does. Help him, so that he doesn't get himself killed... He is unarmed. He gave his weapon to the Changeling. Then he told me to run here, run as fast as I could. And so I did, like a leaf on the wind, like the wind itself-that's how fast I was!

10.Bachelor: Now that's just great...

10.Bachelor: Now that's just great...

8.Bachelor: All right. Seems like I should rather talk to Andrey than you.

8.Bachelor: All right. Seems like I should rather talk to Andrey than you.

6.Bachelor: The Worms? What do the Worms have to do with it?

6.Bachelor: The Worms? What do the Worms have to do with it?

7.Ayan: Haruspex Burakh opened their bride up. Now the earth refuses to grant them herbs. They demanded a woman that has the gift of warmth. If she doesn't lure in herbs for them either, they'll feed her to the earth to stop this plague.

7.Ayan: Haruspex Burakh opened their bride up. Now the earth refuses to grant them herbs. They demanded a woman that has the gift of warmth. If she doesn't lure in herbs for them either, they'll feed her to the earth to stop this plague.

8.Bachelor: And what does that have to do with Eva?

8.Bachelor: And what does that have to do with Eva?

9.Ayan: Haruspex Burakh may have told her about it. He was looking for a woman that has the gift of warmth, one he wouldn't mind giving away. But I've never seen your woman, so I can't say anything for certain.

9.Ayan: Haruspex Burakh may have told her about it. He was looking for a woman that has the gift of warmth, one he wouldn't mind giving away. But I've never seen your woman, so I can't say anything for certain.

10.Bachelor: Why do you insist on spewing nonsense then if you have no idea what you're even talking about? And what does Eva have to do with the Worms?!

10.Bachelor: Why do you insist on spewing nonsense then if you have no idea what you're even talking about? And what does Eva have to do with the Worms?!

He said you two would have to face trouble.

He said you two would have to face trouble.

8.Bachelor: You're coming with me.

2.Bachelor: You are the traitor!

4.Bachelor: That's possible...

2.Bachelor: Don't mind me.

Bachelor & Young Man

1.Young Man: I don't like stories that involve someone going insane... Stamatin shouldn't have gone after her.

1.Young Man: I don't like stories that involve someone going insane... Stamatin shouldn't have gone after her.

2.Bachelor: Where is Andrey?

2.Bachelor: Where is Andrey?

3.Young Man: Andrey has gone to the marsh-to kill Eva's abductors. He was in such a hurry he didn't even wait for me.

3.Young Man: Andrey has gone to the marsh-to kill Eva's abductors. He was in such a hurry he didn't even wait for me.

4.Bachelor: Why would he wait for a chicken?

4.Bachelor: Why would he wait for a chicken?

5.Young Man: I beg your pardon!

6.Bachelor: Pardon denied.

6.Bachelor: Pardon denied.

6.Bachelor: What, am I wrong?

6.Bachelor: What, am I wrong?

7.Young Man: Listen here, your insults are absolutely baseless! I was the person to equip Andrey in the first place. It's not my fault he gave his weapon away to that psychic girl. Here, take this-and give it to him. We've all pitched in...

7.Young Man: Listen here, your insults are absolutely baseless! I was the person to equip Andrey in the first place. It's not my fault he gave his weapon away to that psychic girl. Here, take this-and give it to him. We've all pitched in...

8.Bachelor: I'll do just fine without it. Get away from me. I don't like you.

8.Bachelor: I'll do just fine without it. Get away from me. I don't like you.

8.Bachelor: All right. I'll take it.

8.Bachelor: All right. I'll take it.

4.Bachelor: What marsh?

4.Bachelor: What marsh?

5.Young Man: The marsh where the gatherer lives, the one who wanted to take revenge on Andrey for buying infusion secrets. Then there are butchers, who were finally released from the Termitary today, and they were all too eager to get even with Andrey, having found out that there had been a murderous feud among the gatherers because of him. They also went to that gatherer.

Day 8

Bachelor & Doghead

1.Doghead: What a lovely lady! She welcomed us, she talked to us! Children are not allowed to be in contact with the Kin people, you know... Forbidden fruit and all that. It is the sweetest one.

1.Doghead: What a lovely lady! She welcomed us, she talked to us! Children are not allowed to be in contact with the Kin people, you know... Forbidden fruit and all that. It is the sweetest one.

2.Bachelor: And who might these petitioners be?

3.Doghead: Petitioners indeed! Well, see, we've heard all about your efforts... so, well... we've decided to set up embassy here. We've been told all about your plan to sterilize us all.

4.Bachelor: Sterilize, huh?

4.Bachelor: Sterilize, huh?

5.Doghead: Umm... Wrong wording, I guess? I meant curing us... eh... making us healthy, that is, distributing protective pills, wiping us with spirits, gargle with mouthwash if you please, bathe your feet like a good kid you are? To avoid the infection and stuff.

5.Doghead: Umm... Wrong wording, I guess? I meant curing us... eh... making us healthy, that is, distributing protective pills, wiping us with spirits, gargle with mouthwash if you please, bathe your feet like a good kid you are? To avoid the infection and stuff.

6.Bachelor: Ah, I see... Yes, I did indeed have such a plan.

6.Bachelor: Ah, I see... Yes, I did indeed have such a plan.

7.Doghead: Uncle Bachelor, we don't need vaccine. The order was the Inquisitor's, but you'll be held responsible. Don't! It'll be a simple waste of precious medicine, better give it to our families. We're all healthy up there-and healthy will we remain. Hand on heart.

7.Doghead: Uncle Bachelor, we don't need vaccine. The order was the Inquisitor's, but you'll be held responsible. Don't! It'll be a simple waste of precious medicine, better give it to our families. We're all healthy up there-and healthy will we remain. Hand on heart.

8.Bachelor: What is that supposed to mean, young man?

9.Doghead: Our Tower is magical. It protects us from the outer world. Everybody knows that, duh! And we're, like... See, if you care about us so much, better bring us some dry blue fire that doesn't burn paper! You've come from another place, after all... Do they have that kind of fire there?

12.Bachelor: How are you lot going to return then?

The Tower is only impregnable for the infection from the outside. That's just how it works. The mechanics of it.

13.Doghead: Oh, just ask anyone. Even Capella! Yeah, go pay her a visit! She doesn't believe in the Tower's miracles at all, but she'll provide you with proof all right. She wouldn't lie after all. Which means her testimony is the most reliable one... I guess.

14.Bachelor: All right. I'll talk to Capella.

14.Bachelor: Indeed, she seemed like a very reasonable young lady to me.

2.Bachelor: Aren't you a nimble lad? Behave yourself!

1.Worm: Peace to you, oynon, peace to you. Live and let live-so say the wise...

2.Bachelor: Here you are, you can of worms... So, can I place an order?

2.Bachelor: Here you are, you can of worms... So, can I place an order?

3.Worm: You're more than welcome... We're not asking much, merely thirty thousand. But for you, oynon, it's free! Dead gruel, never better. All the rot comes out, all the evil hexes come off, oh yes, my good man...

4.Bachelor: Merely thirty thousand, huh? Are you sure you're not underselling, mate?

Day 10

Bachelor & Officer

1.Officer: Name. Let's establish your identity first.

1.Officer: Name. Let's establish your identity first.

2.Bachelor: Where's the owner? Who are you?

2.Bachelor: Where's the owner? Who are you?

3.Officer: We're here on duty, kind sir. So you're the offender's friend, then? Or an accomplice?

3.Officer: We're here on duty, kind sir. So you're the offender's friend, then? Or an accomplice?

4.Bachelor: I am his friend.

4.Bachelor: I am his friend.

5.Officer: Then it should be of interest to you that your friend is to be held responsible for the crime of murder in cold blood of four servicemen. Our informer has indicated that the murderous architect resides in this very house. The sentence is to be executed immediately. And now you are going to tell me where the offender can be found.

5.Officer: Then it should be of interest to you that your friend is to be held responsible for the crime of murder in cold blood of four servicemen. Our informer has indicated that the murderous architect resides in this very house. The sentence is to be executed immediately. And now you are going to tell me where the offender can be found.

6.Bachelor: Why in the world would I do that?

6.Bachelor: Why in the world would I do that?

7.Officer: We're going to find the offender sooner or later anyway... We already have tactical data suggesting that one of the offenders is hiding in the ruined building in the central part of the town and is presenting armed resistence. I suggest you cooperate in his arrest. Or else.

7.Officer: We're going to find the offender sooner or later anyway... We already have tactical data suggesting that one of the offenders is hiding in the ruined building in the central part of the town and is presenting armed resistence. I suggest you cooperate in his arrest. Or else.

8.Bachelor: He'll come back here soon. Wait and he'll be here.

8.Bachelor: He'll come back here soon. Wait and he'll be here.

8.Bachelor: But Peter is not guilty! He couldn't have murdered a person!

8.Bachelor: But Peter is not guilty! He couldn't have murdered a person!

6.Bachelor: ...Oh no. Something tells me there's been a mistaken identity issue... Ugh. And what am I supposed to do?

7.Officer: What were you saying?

8.Bachelor: Nothing. Just thinking aloud.

10.Bachelor: He'll come back here soon. Wait and he'll be here.

10.Bachelor: But Peter is not guilty! He couldn't have murdered a person!

Bachelor & Troublemaker

1.Troublemaker: Over here! Listen, people! Hearken to heaven's sign! For this is a parable! Listen to my explication, fair people-for this is a simple sign for us to know who is to blame for all our woes! For all our suffering!

1.Troublemaker: Over here! Listen, people! Hearken to heaven's sign! For this is a parable! Listen to my explication, fair people-for this is a simple sign for us to know who is to blame for all our woes! For all our suffering!

2.Bachelor: And who would that be?

2.Bachelor: And who would that be?

3.Troublemaker: People! Gather around-or better yet, call for your neighbours and relatives and nearest and dearest! For the meaning behind this is as follows: the Kains' tower is killing our town! The bull here represents the town. And the sharp stake, this shameful stake, is a symbol of the Kains' vile creation, their obscene philosophizing!

3.Troublemaker: People! Gather around-or better yet, call for your neighbours and relatives and nearest and dearest! For the meaning behind this is as follows: the Kains' tower is killing our town! 4.Bachelor: What's gotten into you, dear sir?

And Maria, his granddaughter, would soon reach the stars and ply us to her will with her magics, just as her mother Nina used to in days past! She must be killed, torn apart and thrown for the people's relish!

4.Bachelor: Yeah, an obviously reliable source of information born and bred, that one...

4.Bachelor: Yeah, an obviously reliable source of information born and bred, that one...

4.Bachelor: Let's hear what the smart man has to say.

4.Bachelor: Let's hear what the smart man has to say.

2.Bachelor: Of course it's not.

2.Bachelor: Of course it's not.

1.Man: They say to say it's an omen; they say that'll make the soldiers go away. Can't make heads or tails of the whole deal.

1.Man: They say to say it's an omen; they say that'll make the soldiers go away. Can't make heads or tails of the whole deal.

2.Bachelor: Not to worry, I'll get to the bottom of this. Diving in right now.

2.Bachelor: Disperse, all of you! Nothing to see here!

2.Bachelor: Disperse, all of you! Nothing to see here!

Day 11

Bachelor & Dancer Girl

1.Dancer Girl: They took Andrey away! The bold chairman of our feast! We could do nothing. They threatened us with guns and even killed two of us.

1.Dancer Girl: They took Andrey away! The bold chairman of our feast! We could do nothing. They threatened us with guns and even killed two of us.

2.Bachelor: Who took him?

2.Bachelor: Who took him?

3.Dancer Girl: The soldiers! We were resisting them for almost an hour, but they have broken in and turned everything here upside down.

3.Dancer Girl: The soldiers! We were resisting them for almost an hour, but they have broken in and turned everything here upside down.

4.Bachelor: Why did it happen?

4.Bachelor: Why did it happen?

5.Dancer Girl: Yesterday Andrey attacked a patrol while trying to protect his brother. He disarmed the soldiers and killed an officer. Today they came to take revenge on him.

5.Dancer Girl: Yesterday Andrey attacked a patrol while trying to protect his brother. He disarmed the soldiers and killed an officer. Today they came to take revenge on him.

6.Bachelor: Where did they take him?

6.Bachelor: Where did they take him?

7.Dancer Girl: I've heard one of them say that they'd take him to the railway dead end. I think they'll lock our Stamatin in one of the carriages... and then shoot him! He's at the railway dead end-look for him there.

7.Dancer Girl: I've heard one of them say that they'd take him to the railway dead end. I think they'll lock our Stamatin in one of the carriages... and then shoot him! He's at the railway dead end-look for him there.

8.Bachelor: That's a precise description if I've ever heard one... what is this railway dead end?

8.Bachelor: That's a precise description if I've ever heard one... what is this railway dead end?

9.Dancer Girl: Well, I don't know for sure which of the lines is a dead end there! Do I look like a towerwoman? I think that's what they call the line that the military train came by... What, am I wrong?

9.Dancer Girl: Well, I don't know for sure which of the lines is a dead end there! Do I look like a towerwoman? I think that's what they call the line that the military train came by... What, am I wrong?

10.Bachelor: When was he taken away?

12.Bachelor: I'll try to do something.

Bachelor & Patrolman

1.Patrolman: Aha! And here's the good architect. So you came here on your own accord? Willingly? Why no escort?

2.Bachelor: The escort is dead.

3.Patrolman: Ain't you feisty... Why did you come then?

5.Patrolman: I did. Now what?

6.Bachelor: I want to see Alexander Block. If he finds out whom you have shot, you'll be standing against that wall in an hour.

6.Bachelor: I want to see Alexander Block. If he finds out whom you have shot, you'll be standing against that wall in an hour.

7.Patrolman: Your Block is not our superior. He was only just appointed to be our commander. So don't run complaining to him, we don't take orders from the guy.

7.Patrolman: Your Block is not our superior. He was only just appointed to be our commander. So don't run complaining to him, we don't take orders from the guy.

8.Bachelor: You're making a terrible mistake.

9.Patrolman: Come on, hands on the nape, face to the wall. There, to the car. Hand your personal belongings over. Quick-march!

Bachelor & Tot

1.Tot: Daddy couldn't beat the soldiers! There were too many... And I busted a nose to one of them! He grabbed me by the belly, and I so kicked him with the both legs!

1.Tot: Daddy couldn't beat the soldiers! There were too many... And I busted a nose to one of them! He grabbed me by the belly, and I so kicked him with the both legs!

2.Bachelor: What happened next?

2.Bachelor: What happened next?

3.Tot: He was taken to the courtyard, and there the soldiers gathered the men from our entire street! They asked them if they're going to help them arrange a provocation. And Daddy said that they wouldn't! Then the main one, the guy with iron teeth, said, 'To the cemetery-quick-march!' And they took them there... That's all I know!

Bachelor & Teensy

1.Teensy: Hey, look! It's Bachelor, the Bachelor! He'll help us for sure... Uncle Bachelor, is it true that you can do anything?

2.Bachelor: No, not anything-but I can do a lot. Why do you ask?

3.Teensy: Our daddy was taken away by soldiers, and mommy has fallen asleep and doesn't wanna wake up. Please, please, please bring our daddy back!

4.Bachelor: And where is your daddy?

4.Bachelor: And where is your daddy?

6.Bachelor: I can't do it now, pumpkin. I don't have the time.

4.Bachelor: Was he arrested?

4.Bachelor: Was he arrested?

5.Teensy: No, he was not arrested. They came in, pointed the guns at him, grabbed him by the arms, and took him away... The neighbours told us to come here because all the soldiers get their orders here. We came in, but he's not here-never was...

5.Teensy: No, he was not arrested. They came in, pointed the guns at him, grabbed him by the arms, and took him away... The neighbours told us to come here because all the soldiers get their orders here. We came in, but he's not here-never was...

6.Bachelor: Where could he have been taken?

7.Teensy: I don't know... I'm afraid he's already with Grace... Would you please go there and bring him back to me?

Bachelor & Man

2.Bachelor: How many of you were here? Four?

2.Bachelor: How many of you were here? Four?

3.Man: No, way more. Twenty or so. Only four of us are left... And if not for you, there would have been none.

3.Man: No, way more. Twenty or so. Only four of us are left... And if not for you, there would have been none.

As though she walked without touching the ground with her feet...

Day 12

Bachelor & Executor

1.Executor: Are you sure everyone you're in charge of is alive?

1.Executor: Are you sure everyone you're in charge of is alive?

2.Bachelor: I never gave my consent to be in charge of anyone!

2.Bachelor: I never gave my consent to be in charge of anyone!

3.Executor: Wrong. Even if that is your opinion, your conscience must think otherwise. Were you aware that they depend on you? You were. Could you have kept them away from harm? Absolutely. Have you been notified in advance that this is how it's going to end? Definitely. Which means...?

4.Bachelor: Is it still possible to remedy the situation?

If you're one of those lucky few, then good for you! You're welcome to make the round. Offer the medicine to the vulture-faced corpsebringers standing watch by the doors, waiting to hear the owners' last breath... All is not lost yet.

4.Bachelor: I know what it means without your help.

2.Bachelor: How many people would you like me to bring to life?

2.Bachelor: How many people would you like me to bring to life?

3.Executor: 'Would like to'? Us? He must be having a laugh at our expence! We would like nothing. What I find surprising is that you wouldn't like it all that much either, Bachelor! And it's not about 'how many', it's about 'which ones exactly'; although you must know the answer to that question well enough!

4.Bachelor: What if I don't?

6.Bachelor: Which people exacly should stay alive?

I wonder what it's stuffed with-I've always been curious and never had a chance to ask...

4.Bachelor: All right. Wait for me.

6.Bachelor: Damn it!

1.Executor: You are too early. The queens will be deciding upon the fate of the remains of this wretched town at seven o'clock. As for now the Cathedral is closed.

8.Bachelor: Some of them deserve death.

Bachelor & Tot

1.Tot: Hey, look, it's Bachelor! Wow! He's so big! How did you find us? They've already told you, right?

3.Tot: No problem. What do you wanna know?

4.Bachelor: What diabolical game are you playing?

5.Tot: Look! It's a magic sandbox! See how it reflects in the mirrors? It's because everything's for real there! Here's a town, we've made it out of sand. And there's this awful thing going on there-an EPIDEMIC! So it's all crumbling... the town is falling apart... But we've sent heroes there to fix it.

5.Tot: Look! It's a magic sandbox! See how it reflects in the mirrors? It's because everything's for real there! Here's a town, we've made it out of sand. And there's this awful thing going on there-an EPIDEMIC! So it's all crumbling... the town is falling apart... But we've sent heroes there to fix it.

6.Bachelor: To fix it?
